Software Engineer

  The Opportunity:

Z-Tech (Canada) Inc. is growing and we are seeking a talented and motivated software engineer.

About Us:

Z-Tech is focused on the development and marketing of innovative methods of detecting breast cancer. Z-Tech뭩 core group of engineers, software developers, physicians, financial and marketing personnel have long standing expertise and experience in the field of electromedical devices. Z-Tech has developed a revolutionary screening technology for the detection of breast cancer. Large scale clinical trials in the U.S., Canada and overseas will begin January 2003.

Location:

Our temporary head office is located on Pape north of Danforth. Relocation is possible but our head office will remain in south-central Toronto.


The successful candidate will:

- Design and develop a user interface and embedded software in Visual Basic, Access, and C, to be used in a next generation breast cancer detection device.
- Design Windows device drivers using the Windows XP DDK.
- Interface with hardware designers to design hardware/software interfaces.
- Design test programs and procedures for finished systems and components.
- Verify and validate existing designs and prototypes.
- Use MatLab and Excel to perform data-analysis and mathematical modeling.
- Develop and maintain an internal web-server and web-server applications.
- Administer configuration and change control activities using PVCS or a similar tool.
- Author user manuals, procedures, and other technical documentation.



Qualifications:

- B.Sc. Electrical/Computer Engineering
- Minimum of 2 years of experience
- Excellent spoken and written English
- Ability to solve problems independently and work with minimal supervision
- Understanding of software engineering principles (models, cycles, responsibilities)
- Working knowledge of: C, VB, VBA, Access.
- The following knowledge would an asset: TI 54x DSP, MatLab, Perl, Java, Apache Server, Linux, Digital and Analog Circuit Design.
- Knowledge of statistical and analytical methods, including finite-element-modeling and signal processing theory.



What's in it for you?

- Competitive salary and benefits
- Contribute to a growing company doing important, exciting work
- Opportunity to work in a small fast-paced development environment in which your individual contribution will be recognized.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, however only qualified candidates will be contacted.


Additional Information
Position Type: Full Time, Permanent
